name: blower
content:
blower noun [C]
(BLOWING AIR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device that blows out air, for example to heat or cool a place, or to remove something from a place: Turn the heater control to hot, and set the blower to medium/high speed. Use the blower to collect the leaves into piles. See also
snow blower
leaf blower
a person who blows air down a tube to shape heated glass into objects: When the blower is attaching bases to wine glasses, the stem will slide off if the glass is too hot, and won't stick if it's too cold. Synonym
glassblower
More examplesFewer examplesA fire official said that the blowers that remove smoke from the building weren't working.The car was freezing so we rolled up the windows and put the blowers on high. He switched on the blower and a stream of warm air gushed out at them.Track workers used blowers and sweepers to try to get the loose materials off the track before the race.The agency had dispatched about 115 workers with 35 ploughs, blowers and snow-clearing trucks.
